ygData.subject: How the mighty have fallen
ygData.msgSnippet: Prebon doesn t want to risk breaking comm silence but knows that Slayers life is the last hope the Trainers have of surviving this battle. He opens his comm to

From: "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@...>

Prebon doesn't want to risk breaking comm silence but knows that Slayers
life is the last hope the Trainers have of surviving this battle. He opens
his comm to the wolf. "Get Ignatius back  to base fast as poss....." before
he can finish his order the water becomes a conductor and sends electricity
through the Trainer commander. At first the energy revives his power, then
it begins to overload his receptors causing a failsafe system to take over.
All his systems shut down to compensate for the overload. Prebon ejected his
armor and floated to the surface trapped in Stasis Lock, unable to move or
defend himself. The once mighty bot was now at the mercy of the very bots
he'd seeked to overthrow.
----- Original Message -----
From: <Yanshosh@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, January 21, 2001 12:14 AM
Subject: Re: D


> ::Iron Fist/Griplash/Slayer/Havoc::
>
> Griplash climbs ashore (destroyed shore of Spain), collapsing and
> going into stasis lock.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Slayer erupts from the water, carrying Iguanus with him. He activates
> his comm.
>
> "Prebon, I got iguanus. What do you want me to do now?"
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Seeing Slayer, Havoc changes course, flying at the bot.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> The four poles that the Iron Fist had slid out earlier begin to hum
> slightly. Millions of volts of electricity are pumped into the water,
> streaming all around. Frying dead fish float to the surface.
>
>
>
>
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > I would've replied sooner but my servers been stubborn and wouldn't
> let me
> > send or recieve.
> >
> > Prebon continued to follow Fenox ready for anything. his scanners
> had
> > cleared so it was logical that the alliances had too. Without his
> jetpack he
> > could only use jaunts from his feet if he needed added speed, he
> wouldn't
> > hesitate to use them when the time was right.
>
>
>
